Who am I?

Hi, my name is Redwan, and I'm an aspiring data scientist and machine learning practitioner.

Although a life scientist by training, I have long since held a fascination with artificial intelligence, its real-world applications and philosophical implications. After taking courses in machine learning, I fell head over heels and decided to stop being a spectator. I've since then aligned my life with the goal of pursuing a career in data science and eventually contributing to and innovating in the field of AI. I write this blog to chronicle my journey, sharing what I've learned and a few projects I'm working on—hopefully it's helpful for others also making the transition.

What have I done?

I recently received a PhD in molecular physiology from Baylor College of Medicine where I used carbon nanotechnology to develop a new treatment for autoimmune diseases. During grad school, I also founded and led a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that trains scientists and doctors to become management consultants. Previously, I worked in biomedical R&D and venture capital.

How to get in touch

Feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn or GitHub. If you'd like to be notified of new blog posts, you can subscribe to the feed or follow me on Twitter, which I use almost exclusively to talk about AI and data science. If you have any questions, tips or comments, don't hesitate to contact me directly. Thanks for visiting!
